I highly recommend her class.

Dr. Ngeve is one of the best professors I had this semester. She is a kind person and has her student's success in mind, she gives a ton of extra credit and gives genuine feedback. Her exams are fair, as she allows an index card in the room, there is just a lot of information given in such a short time, so it's important to stay on track. Dr. Ngeve also provides many resources to understand better the concepts she covers.

She was one of the best professors I had this semester as she provides all the resources you need to succeed. Her lectures are engaging if not a bit rushed at times due to the amount of information she covers in each lecture. She also provides recordings of each of her lectures along side the slideshow. The exams are fair though they are a bit packed in terms of questions and material but you will do fine as long as you study beforehand. She also provides plenty of extra credit if you do need it!

Dr. Ngeve is a very good professor who cares about her students and how well they do in class. The exams are fair, but they can be pretty long. 
One pro about her and her class is that she provides lots of extra credit opportunities which you should take for granted. She also gives other assignments which help in improving your grade, but they can be pretty long. All the slides and information she goes over are provided, and she puts up her lecture schedules so we know what we are learning in future classes, she always puts in slides for future lectures  Dr. Ngeve's class is very comforting and engaging, and she encourages everyone to ask questions. A few cons are that she provides lots of information and materials in one lecture, and she can go fast sometimes. There are times when we would go through half of the material and expect you to at least go through the rest of the slides for the next class. There were only a few times when she continued the materials into the next lecture, but don't think she will do it all the time. There are a lot of slides and information that have to be covered. Overall I highly recommend Dr. Ngeve for BSCI 160. I never had a problem with her and if I ever have to take a class she is teaching I would go for her right away.
She da goat fr, take the class, minimal effort needed for A+

Very caring and approachable. The only reason she may be fast at some time is because the professors are required to teach a certain amount of things. The professor posts recorded lectures and slides on the canvas page which are very helpful if you miss class or so. There are many extra credit opportunities in this class. If you ever need help understanding a topic she is always there during office hours. All in all, she cares about her students and wants them to pass!

Dr. Ngeve is overall one of my favorite professors. She gives presentations with a lot of information, then connects the topics through her lectures in an easily digestible way. There are a lot of opportunities to practice and earn points, and she is lenient with exam grades (allows notecards and drops lowest exam).

I enjoyed having Dr. Ngeve as a professor! I especially appreciate how there are many different ways to supplement your learning such as EC assignments, TNR discussions, etc. If you stay consistent with the workload, you'll be successful in the class. My only criticism is that there was an overload of information in the lecture which was almost never completely covered which meant having to learn some of the material at home. If you don't have other commitments/classes to worry about, then this isn't a huge deal, but as a first-year fall semester student, this was a lot for me to adjust to. Overall though, I would recommend Dr. Ngeve!

Very good professor that provides lots of extra credit opportunities and is very helpful at answering questions. She really cares about her students! There is lots of material for this class, but it is not too difficult if you do a little bit of studying. Notecards are very helpful for exams and lots of questions are reused from lectures. As long as you take advantage of extra credit opportunities, and study for exams, you should be fine.

A lot of work for a BSCI160 class which I guess should be expected considering its ecology and evolution which will have a lot of material covered. Dr. Ngeve is really understanding and delayed homework deadlines multiple times for the class. One small note card is allowed on each midterm. Three midterms and a final, with the lowest midterm dropped. The second exam which had a lot of genetics on it had WAY too many questions on it but she listened and shortened the length of it for the third exam. There are so many extra credit opportunities to the point where any points you get off on the remaining two exams will be covered by those extra credit points. The final is also open book in person. Overall, a manageable class taught by a good professor but definitely don't underestimate the coursework and material. I'm giving her five stars because although she wasn't perfect (rushed us on the clicker questions and sometimes taught too fast), I doubt the other professors teaching this class would be better than her.

Ngeve was one of the first professors I have had during college to be so passionate about her subject and what she does, so receptive to feedback, and so kind! She provides countless extra credit opportunities it is crazy, and she provides multiple resources to help you understand the content. If you have to take BSCI160 please try your best to take it with her!!

She is a great professor! She explains things well and gives lots of extra credit so your grade will be high no matter what. She's very nice and understanding and is willing to work with you if you are sick or have accommodations.
She is a very kind professor and very understanding. She gives lots of assignments that cushion exam grades and there are lots of areas for extra credit. I definitely recommend.
10/10 great class would take again would recommended.

Great prof. Very approachable and good at explaining hard-to-understand topics. Also does a great job of connecting topics back to stuff we alr learned in order to encorange a big-picture understanding—also, a ton of extra credit.
Tests are fair and powerpoints in class cover all the content.

Dr. Ngeve is overall a wonderful teacher! She's very nice and very knowledgeable but the only thing to be wary of is that the lecture slides can be very long which means lots of notes. And sometimes if you don't manage your time with the HW it can feel like a lot the night before, but other than that there's actually very few homework assignments and she gives out extra credit like candy (which she literally does during tests as well). All the tests are fair and she doesn't cheat you out of anything, so all in all a good majority of the class is just the work you put into it and what you get out of it.
They were really good and organized professor + they were flexible when I fell behind toward the end of the semester?

Professor Ngeve is extremely smart. She is incredibly fair on the exams, and offers a ton of extra credit work to boost your grade. The homework assignments can be long so, I would recommend not procrastinating to do them. At times it can be hard to understand Professor Ngeve, and her slides are extremely long. At times it can be hard to understand what you need to study, because she offers so much information. In the end she is a great professor and I would definitely recommend taking her if possible

Ngeve is so far the only professor I have that does extra credit and I am extremely thankful. She drops the lowest midterm, you can have a 3x5 notecard, the final is shh open note. It is honestly hard to fail this class unless you are lazy. In all honestly I would only study two days before and did just fine. The extra credits may seem a lot but you can do some parts of a set and get 1 or 2 points which you might as well to help. Even if they feel like busy work or her TNR assignments feel like too much they are easy ways to get an A. It's crazy how my major course is easier than my supporting courses but once again I am extremely thankful. Her lectures sometimes confuse you and you may get stressed bbut honestly stuffing my notecard and highlighting key words helped me with my midterms so much. I strongly believe she is one of the best professors and cares about you. I think if I took advantage of oppourtunities and studied more I would have well over a 100% compared to my current general A+.
10/10 would take again

Amazing professor. As long as you attend class and actively listen you should do good. The workload is manageable, and the professor also gives many extra credit opportunities. Overall Dr. Ngeve is an amazing professor, and she will be very understanding and reasonable during the course.

Overall a good professor, the slides are not always the most relevant to what will be on the tests, but still a good resource. Professor Ngeve is always open to answering questions to help you understand the material. The classwork assigned is reasonable, and somewhat helpful for the exams. Overall, I recommend her as a prof.
Professor Ngeve is so nice and understanding. There is a lot of extra credit available and it is really easy to keep up with the work in the class.

She is obviously very passionate about the subject and cares about her students. She is really good at responding to emails and discussion posts quickly. However, this class goes very in-depth and is very detailed, and it is hard to stay engaged if you are not also interested in the subjects.

Class was an average biology class, typically what you expect, lots of slideshows and information, but rather easy as long as you actually do work. Her lectures can get boring because she talks the whole time start to finish but thats just because it's also just biology. As long as you do your work every week and stay with the slides you can easily get an A because of her extra credit and dropping one exam. Also very important to note she as a pretty thick accent, shes a great person and very understanding but its hard to understand her lecturing, I probably would do the same in her class not going to class and reviewing slides myself than going into class tired or not attentive. Good professor to take overall, workload is average/intermediete difficulty with more on the time consuming side than hard.
Dr. Ngeve is caring and super cool. She gave tons of extra credit assignments which boosted my grades up but I had some hard time with the exams.
Dr. Ngeve is a good professor, but is hard to understand some times. She often adds leans too much on memorization of trivial things in the exams, but overall she is good.

Dr. Ngeve cares about your learning and growth in the course. She is always willing to answer any questions and genuinely enjoys teaching. This course has a lot of material, exams are difficult, but she allows you to use a notecard front and back with notes.

Wasn't sure what to expect when starting this class but I would recommend Dr. Ngeve for anyone taking BSCI160. She seems to enjoy teaching about the material and provides a lot of other assignments and extra credit so if you maybe didn't do well on one of the exams there is some other support to keep your grade up. She also drops the lowest exam score. Although her lectures do tend to get quite boring at times. Despite that though she's a pretty nice instructor.

Truly my favorite professor I have ever had. She is so kind and accommodating. When I tore a ligament in my ankle and missed an exam, she actually reached out to me via email to see if I was okay. Despite having a massive class and so many students to take care of, she takes the time to get to know you individually and genuinely cares about you as a person. Beyond that, she is a very good lecturer and really cares about your success and gives you all the tools you need to succeed! If you can, definitely take her!

He’s a nice person BUT his class is  super messy, and his exams are HARD! The amount of content you’ll need to know for his exams is crazy and the multiple choice section is specifically designed to trick you! I just didn’t enjoy his class at all! Out of all the other classes I’m taking this was supposed to be “the easiest one” and ended up being an absolute nightmare.
Amazing teacher, she is so willing to help with any questions you have about homework, lecture slides, and general concepts. Absolutely recommend her as an instructor!

Professor Ngeve teaches a difficult course full of content that I definitely would've struggled with if not for the plentiful extra credit she provides almost weekly. Even with my not-so-amazing exam scores, I still currently have a high A, although my third exam has yet to be graded and I haven't taken my final (which is open note and open internet!!). The exams are difficult but are based on the material that is taught in class and in the slides. Study the TNR, slides, point solution questions, and you should be good., The only problem I have with this class is the fact that the slides are hard to read, as they contain what feels like random information. In addition, her method of lecturing is hard to digest, which led to me more often than not teaching myself the information while I was in class. Overall, your grade will probably be good if you take this class but don't expect to retain the information or learn from her lecturing because it is practically impossible.

Dr. Ngeve actually responds to student feedback during the semester and lectures. She lectures well and ensures the students understand what is being taught. The exams cover the material pretty well. She also provides many extra credit opportunities on the exams, through discussions, or other means. She posts nearly every material used from the clickers and their answers, weekly reviews, lecture slides/recordings, and homework. She also gives many additional resources. We were also allowed a notecard for each midterm. The weekly review can take some time but it does actually help you learn the material better. In my opinion, you have a lot of opportunities to put in the work and do well.
She is very kind and understanding. She makes sure to have multiple resources to refer to so that you can always catch back up. She isn't against you like other teachers seem. She is on your side!

Hands down the best professor I had for my first semester at UMD. She is very knowledgeable on the course content and actively encourages students to present questions whenever they have them, during lecture or otherwise. There are a lot of options to earn extra credit through group assignments and post-exam reflections. On each midterm, you are allowed to bring a 3x5 notecard and the lowest midterm grade is dropped. BSCI160 covers a lot of content, but you are very likely to succeed if you use the resources that she provides and take time to study. I highly recommend taking her.

Dr. Ngeve is very kind and accommodating and offers numerous extra credit opportunities. The only thing that I struggled with is not having enough time to complete the midterms as there were many questions given in a short time (both long responses and multiple choice).

One of the best professors I've had. The lowest midterm grade is dropped and you can use a notecard on all exams. There are lots of opportunities for extra credit, and there are more than enough resources provided for you to succeed in the class.
Very good professor and gives a lot of opportunity for extra credit.

Definitely a great class; Dr. Ngeve is always so supportive and always provides extra credit for us to do, which is always helpful to get a lift in your grade as well as learn more about the concepts. Overall, a 5 star professor.

Ms. Ngeve is a great professor. She's reasonable with her workload and includes a lot of opportunities to better understand the material. She records a lecture for every topic and includes practice problems and the slides. The tests resemble what she has taught and highlighted throughout her lectures. In general, she wants you to learn and pass with a good grade, as shown through her great load of extra credit opportunities.
Amazing professor and offers a lot of resources to help you succeed!

Dr. Ngeve was a wonderful professor. Throughout the semester, she provided quick feedback to her students and many opportunities to have questions answered before exams. Her exams were very fair, with all the content being available to students in her lecture slides or point solution questions. Her lectures are very informative and she provides you with the opportunity to drop one midterm grade, which is great! Overall, I'd highly recommend her!

Dr. Ngeve is an amazing teacher who offers a lot of extra credit opportunities and the course material is very easy to understand. She encourages students to ask questions and answers questions very efficiently.

Dr. Ngeve is a good professor; she is very welcoming and encourages students to speak in class. Her material tends to be easily understandable, with slide presentations to help. Her slides can be a little long and may go over the lecture time frame, requiring you to learn the rest of the material on your own, but that's not much different from what you will experience in other classes or lectures. She provides a good amount of extra credit assignments that will definitely help your grade if you need them. Her exams are fairly easy if you pay attention to her lectures and take time to study. She will always answer any question you may have and genuinely wants for her students to do well. Great class!

Dr. Ngeve is a great professor and truly shows how much she cares about her students. She gives so many opportunities for extra credit, and is always available for questions. She is one of the few professors who I felt actually cared about our mental health and wellbeing, and was very understanding overall. The lectures contained a lot of material that often were hard to keep up with, but Dr. Ngeve provides many resources outside of lecture to assist in learning the content. I definitely recommend Dr. Ngeve to anyone who is going to take this class.

Professor Ngeve is probably the best professor for BSCI 160. The course if very information heavy so I would definitely recommend finding your niche and way of studying if you want to success but I would say it’s hard to not succeed with a professor like Ngeve. She is very detail orientated with the way she has the course set up so you can always read ahead or look at lecture recordings. Although she doesn’t curve she gives a good amount of extra credit that will help you to boost your grade and the ULA review sessions are helpful. The class is also 5% participation via point solution so even though lectures are recorded I would recommend going just so you can reinforce the information you’re learning. If you have any questions Professor Negev is open to helping you with anything and she prioritizes your success. She also drops your lowest exam score within the course which is definitely helpful for those who are struggling to adjust to the rigor of college academics. I would definitely recommend her as a professor she’s super sweet and a great lecturer.

Ngeve is great and the class is easy but not going to lectures really hit me, she has required point solutions which count for actual points and since I haven't gone to many lectures, my grade took a pretty big hit. She does give a lot of extra credit and you're allowed a notecard on exams which helps though.
Dr. Ngeve does provide the relevant info for exams, but she is difficult to understand in class and her slides are cluttered.
nice teacher, provides lots of extra credit.
Very organized and knowledgable professor. She gives out many extra credit activities that boosted my grade. She is very open to questions and eager to answer questions.

She is a great professor who is extremely responsive to feedback and is generous with how she grades. Although exams are a bit difficult, she gives a lot of resources to study from, a lot of extra credit to make up grades, and drops the lowest exam grade. She also allows the use of a notecard on an exam. She is someone who wants her students to do good and all you need to do is meet her halfway in order to excel in her class.

This class overall had a lot of content which made it difficult to always keep up. Dr. Ngeve had longer lectures but she gave a lot of extra credit work which helped out a lot. She also always reached out to send available resources to help as well as answer the required questions in our discussion posts to clear up any confusion. The exams can be a little difficult but she provides review packets as well as a list of important vocabulary words to know before each exam.

Lectures are fast and Dr. Ngeve can be difficult to understand sometimes. However, those are the only bad, not really bad, things I have to say about her course. There are so many extra credit opportunities to improve your grade, you'll be happy and enjoy doing it with your group (I made friends from these groups). I have never been to her office hours or emailed her personally, but she is a very welcoming teacher who tries her very best to be accessible to her students. Her lecture notes and point solution questions are the keys to success in her class (and the extra credit assignments too in my opinion). I am not very interested in Ecology and tried my best to stay engaged, but having this professor made my efforts easy. The bad reviews here will be mostly about not being able to understand her at times, but the resources she provides make up for it. "A lot of work" is the amount of work you'll find in any other class. She cares very much about student success and it shows even if you don't talk with her personally. I hope you have the opportunity to take her, she'll be a favorite amongst professors for sure.

Dr. Ngeve was one of the sweetest professors ever. She always was willing to help & never turned down a question (even if the lecture was going slow). She had office hours known & I think the longest I had to wait for an email back was a few hours. In class, the lectures are uploaded online & so are the slides, so taking notes was super easy. There were numerous extra credit opportunities & I did them all, so although my exam average is around 73%, I have a 104% in the class before our open note final. I would definitely recommend Dr. Ngeve to anyone who is taking BSCI160 as she was very understandable & approachable.

Exams are extremely difficult for an intro level ecology class. There isn't really a curve. Lectures are hard to follow and there is a lot of complicated information that you need to attain if you want to do somewhat well on the exams. Hardest course I have ever taken, wouldn't recommend taking this course or this professor.

I really loved her and the structure of her class. She is really passionate about what she teaches and it shows. Offered TONS of individual extra credit and group extra credit assignments, so if you are worried about your grade you have so many opportunities to improve it. The homework and assignments are never too hard or time consuming, and I genuinely found the class interesting. She is also really willing to accommodate/make changes to exams or assignments, for our 3rd midterm she shortened the length and number of questions because people had given feedback that there were too many/long questions. Every lecture is recorded and so are all the review sessions, so you will never get behind. Also, a lot of questions on the midterms are ones we go over in class for participation points on Point Solutions, which is extremely nice. Minimum stress class (especially compared to chem), sweet, caring professor.

I love professor Ngeve so much. She is genuinely a nice person and will answer any question you have. Her lectures are lengthy and filled with a lot of information but that's just how the class is. There was a ton of extra credit that you could do to maintain a good grade in the class and the questions she did in class to go over the slides was really helpful when it came to exams.
Professor Ngeve is a great professor! She is easy to get in contact with and very helpful during office hours. She offers many extra credit oppotunities to help maintain a passing grade in her class.

Dr. Ngeve is a pretty engaging and fair professor. Her exams are fair and they contain Point solutions questions for at about a quarter of the exam. Go to her lectures and you will get free points by doing all the points solutions. She also offers a lot of extra credit and this is beneficial to most students. She is a bit slow on the lectures but she will get through most of her slides in the period leaving minimal note taking at home. She also has very accurate slides and her exams are on the material in her powerpoints. Overall I give her 5 stars because despite her lack of engagement and speed she is very fair and gives out a lot of grade boosting extra credit.
She is a good instructor and a fair grader. She offers lots of opportunities to improve your grade, and is understanding of circumstances.
lots of opportunities to improve your grade throughout the semester, the exams are not too bad...a lot of content but you will be fine if you study.

Other reviews for her are underrating her. She only tests on information she teaches and all of the information on the extra credit and Homework is on the exam. If you do the work she assigns you will get an A. The best Science professor I've had at UMD.

If you are taking bsci 160 then you should 100% take Dr Ngeve. She is a very understanding professor and granted extensions to many assignments due to some of the unforeseen circumstances which occurred on campus this semester. She also genuinely cares about her students and wants you to succeed. The workload for this course is very manageable and Dr Ngeve has so many opportunities for extra credit that can be a massive boost to your grade. The only two drawbacks in my opinion are that participation is a portion of your grade so you have to attend class for the most part, and that the TA's grade very hard. Although there is a lot of information being thrown at you during lectures, I think I would have been fine going over the slides on my own. Overall Dr Ngeve is an amazing professor and I highly recommend taking her class.

Ngeve is a great teacher. While it can sometimes be hard to understand her and she goes fast in lectures she wears a mic which is helpful as you can hear her anywhere in the room. She doesn't curve but does give a ridiculous amount of extra credit to make up for that. So even if you dont do well on the exams as long as you do the all the extra credit youll do great. The course is what you make it so if you do the extra credit you can easily have over a 100% even if you did bad on the midterms I know so many people who didnt do well on the midterms but did all the extra credit so they had over 100%. the homeworks are annoying and so are the TNR. So if you are willing to put in a little more work to do the extra credit you'll have an A and itll be easy but if you dont think you'll be able to do the extra work for the credit take a different teacher.

A very professional and caring professor. She gives a ton of extra credit and many opportunities for extra points. She allows a notecard on midterms and drops the lowest midterm grade. She genuinely wants us to do well. Brought a huge bag of candy to our exam that was on Halloween. As for people saying they have trouble understanding her, I had some difficulties, but then again, and she provides all course materials so you can go through the slides on your own if you need.

Professor Ngeve has fair exams that are relevant to her lectures and homeworks. She offers lots of extra credit and loves student feedback. Her homeworks and optional learning activities are great study resources. She clearly demonstrates that she wants all students taking her course to succeed! She is very informative, knowledgable, and engaging!
Best professor ever! I learned so many new things about ecology and evolution of animals.
Dr. Ngeve is a very nice teacher. She always cares about her students. She also gives a lot of extra credit.

Highly recommend Prof Ngeve. The course material is not highly complicated but does require a bit of studying for exams. Prof Ngeve is very interactive and wants to ensure that students understand the material as best as possible.
Cares about students would recommend taking the extra credit opportunities seriously
She is a decent overall teacher, gives lots of extra credit, and tries to make the class interesting.
Very passionate about the course and will slow down or speed up as necessary to help the class's learning.
Professore Ngeve responds in a very timely manner, provides a lot of extra credits, and cares about her students a lot. I would recommend her.

Dr. Ngeve is a kind-hearted professor who wants all of her students to succeed. She gives a lot of extra credit opportunities (group and individual assignments). She also allows students to have a notecard during the 3 three midterm exams. Dr. Ngeve posts the recorded lecture and slides, which becomes useful when studying for exams. The course itself may not be everyone's cup of tea (nothing to do with Dr. Ngeve) because it doesn't necessarily cover "traditional" bio concepts. Since it is an ecology and evolution course, it focuses more on environmental conditions and their impact on organisms. The homework is a little long, but she gives an adequate amount of time to finish it. The TAs can be harsh graders at times. Overall, Dr. Ngeve is an understanding professor.

I appreciate her as a professor. She was very knowledgeable about Biology and you could tell she has a passion for what she teaches. In terms of the class, it is easy to pass and not a class that I have had to worry about. She provides 30 in-class participation points for doing the clickers, and you have a 5-class wiggle room (to my knowledge). She also has a VERY large amount of extra credit assignments for you to complete for points, 4 of these include LA worksheets which are meant to be completed and turned in with your prechosen LA group, which I found very annoying at times given I had a good group which a good response rate but I know people whose group did not attempt to do the worksheet as well and you were left to do it yourself for just 4 extra credit points. Aside from this, the homework assignments (We have 5 throughout the semester) were very helpful for studying for the exams. The exams are canvas protected and you are allowed one 3x5 notecard, I tended to squeeze a lot of information on the notecards as the exams would ask for specifics at times and the exams had (what I feel) a high volume of free response questions. Overall I had a C average on the three midterms that we had. I also really liked her canvas page and you can tell a lot of thought was put into it. The lecture schedule has a comprehensive list of all of the assignments expected for the semester and she does not stray much from it. She has all the lectures pre-recorded and posts all of the slides that were used in class, a downside to this is that if she does not finish going over slides in class she expects you to finish going over them outside of class to stay on track. There are also ULA reviews that the TAs host which are similar to GSS and these too are recorded and posted on Canvas. Lastly for our final, it is a canvas proctored open internet and open note final which truly takes the stress off of me with my other finals. While I will not say this class was an easy A because it is very easy to fall behind, with all the Extra credit and help she posts on the canvas page, you have to actively try to fail this class. With my C average on exams and the Extra credit, I currently have a 100.50 in this class.
She is the most supportive teacher and she is always willing to help. A LOT of extra credit.
The lectures are boring and are not that interesting but the professor is extremely organized and provides a lot of extra credit opportunities.

Dr. Ngeve is a very organized professor. She makes due dates very clear and keeps all of the lectures available and in order so that students may review them when they need to. The TAs are very kind and offer a lot of support on His outside of class. I recommend taking this course as it can be a lot of work but is a fair and manageable class.
Professor Ngeve is a great teacher. She is Understanding and cares for all her students. She gives a lot of extra credits and resources for you to be successful in the course.

Prof. Bruns is a fantastic teacher. She's engaging and it's clear that she has a genuine passion for the field and enjoyment of teaching the content to the students. Exams were pretty typical, we could bring a notecard and they weren't too difficult. Lectures were also quite typical, just taking notes from slideshows. Overall, this is a course with decent content that I really enjoyed, in no small part thanks to the energy Prof. Bruns brought to class everyday.
Very very helpful, gives a lot of extra credit!
It really shows that she cares for her students, and I appreciated it so much. Probably my favourite professor that I had this semester.

I'll give the quick rundown. Drops the lowest midterm, lots of extra credit but take a good chunk of time, assignments for this class will never be quick and will take a lot of time, you can't really understand her, has lots of slides and speeds through them. If you drift off for a few seconds you will be a couple slides behind already. Her exams are not so bad except sometimes the MC are lowley trick questions (as in bc one word was added or removed to the statement it is the opposite of what you were taught). Some freaks always say the pace is fine but I am always scrambling to jot down the notes. You really have to be able to multitask with note taking and listening to her or else you will very much fall behind. The only thing saving my butt is the extra credit.

I am not an ecology or evolution person and I'm more into anatomy and physiology (I'm pre-med) but I loved going to Dr. Ngeve for lectures. She is very understanding and cares about each and every one of her students. She records lectures but you will need to go in person for class participation points. You will need to put a good amount of work into the class to maintain a good grade but she offers lots of extra credits. I did the extra credit LA assignments plus a couple of individual extra credit assignments and I currently have an A in the class despite getting a B- and 2 B+'s on the midterm. The homework is also very useful as well as ULA review sheets as a way to study. Take her if you can! She was the best professor I had this semester!

Great personality. Passionate. Cares about students. The only negative is his lecture style. He is genuinely a boring person and talks very slow. The only way I could get through this class was "recording" his lectures and listening again some time later in 2x speed. His slides literally include no information-just some pictures and graphs without description. So you need to focus on what he says but since it is very difficult to stay focused during his lectures, recording helps. The worst part: his slides are not organized at all so you have to make connections between topics yourself. He wants you to focus on big ideas but that's why this class is challenging for most people. Without knowing the details, it's hard to understand the big picture. He did not explain the genetics unit well yet the questions on the midterms wanted us to know the details. So good luck with that unit especially. We only learned 1/4 of what the other class is learning and ran out of time at the end (the last few topics were rushed). But again, we can use cheat sheets for all 3 midterms & the final, and most questions on the final were taken from the past exams word for word. Lastly, his TAs were very helpful (although there weren't GSS sessions, they were welcoming during office hours and a lot of people showed up to do homework and ask questions). I recommend using TA office hours to your benefit and take the practice exam before each exam.

Dr. Shapiro is clearly very passionate about what he teaches. He is very understanding with curves, dropping lowest midterm, extend HW deadlines for the whole class, and even allows an index card of notes during exams. That said, he isn't the best lecturer. The class structure feels disorganized, boring, and he can go on tangents that drag on and on. Also, the HWs are graded very harshly and by accuracy. With all this said, I would still recommend him. The content of the course isn't very hard, and you will do just fine if you put in the effort.

Please do not take this professor if you want an A unless you have a strong background in bio. Lectures literally are so disorganized. Little to no feedback on assignments. Even asking clarifying questions somehow makes things even more unclear. Could not emphasize how much I do not recommend.

She is one of the sweetest professors ever but also severely disorganized. She doesn't teach how to do practice problems and makes due dates overlap. Her exam questions are not always related to lecture and she expects you to have a lot of background knowledge. Only reason I got an A in the class is because she provides LOTS of extra credit opportunities and drops your lowest midterm. But even then I would not suggest taking her because she is online.

This class can be boring at times but not at all too difficult. He drops the lowest midterm (which helps a LOT) and can be lenient when it comes to deadlines. Exams are hard but fair: everything that is on the exam can be found on a slideshow (that he posts)

Dr. Bruns was very passionate about eco and evolution! There is a lot of material to cover but she makes it very straight forward. I was balancing Orgo 1 with this class so my time was split making it difficult to completely focus on BSCI160, so my grade is a little lower. Overall, I would take her again! She is the best professor to teach this course.
Extremely difficult, it's confusing even with TAs helping sometimes. Otherwise, it's boring. Don't take.
His tests are extremely difficult and the material he covers is not fairly represented on the exam. He yaps too much

Dr. Shapiro is clearly knowledgeable and a good teacher. His exams aren't too bad and the practice exams are really helpful. The homework assignments are only a few questions, but I would sometimes have to go to office hours about them. If you're still allowed to work together, I highly recommend. The course is definitely easier if you took AP/IB biology in high school (it's literally the same thing) but still manageable if you didn't.

Dr. Shapiro is a passionate and a nice guy but he is not the best lecturer. He is very slow to get to the point, and his lessons are disorganized and boring. The exams are difficult---half of it consists of multiple choice questions that are designed to trick you. The other half are short answers and fill in the blanks which are thankfully much easier and straightforward. I expected this class to be an easy A but be warned, it is not. Ecology and evolution was one of my favorite subjects and this class has only discouraged me.

name: BSCI160
title: Principles of Ecology and Evolution
description: Prerequisite: Must have math eligibility of MATH120 or higher. Recommended: For Science majors. Credit only granted for: BSCI106 or BSCI160. Formerly: BSCI106. Basic principles of biology with special emphasis on ecological and evolutionary biology. (Sponsoring Dept.: BSCI).
